page.title: 08Court House, Ceres
page.content:
Situated in High Street, probably the oldest and most picturesque part of the village, Fife Folk Museum used to be the Baron's Court House with its own prison cell, and the Weigh House.
Outside, on the right of the door, hang the "Jougs". They consist of an iron ring which went round the neck of an offender and two iron bracelets which held him to the wall.
Above the door, carved into the stone, are the Scales of Justice with the inscription "God Bless The Just."
In 1968 it became the Fife Folk Museum.
Nowadays this area is visited by many tourists and parties of children from Fife schools.
